comment: With the new movie "Bohemian Rhapsody" I got to know about Freddie Mercury, the lead singer of the British band "Queen" and one of the greatest vocalists of all time. The fact that he was and continues to be admired by millions of people all over the world , in spite of not being white or straight , shows how ultimately such differences do not really matter.
amr:
# ::snt With the new movie "Bohemian Rhapsody" I got to know about Freddie Mercury, the lead singer of the British band "Queen" and one of the greatest vocalists of all time. The fact that he was and continues to be admired by millions of people all over the world , in spite of not being white or straight , shows how ultimately such differences do not really matter.
(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (g / get-22
            :ARG0 (ii / i)
            :ARG1 (k / know-02
                  :ARG0 ii
                  :ARG1 (p / person
                        :name (n / name
                              :op1 "Freddie"
                              :op2 "Mercury")
                        :ARG0-of (s / sing-01
                              :ARG2 (b / band
                                    :name (n2 / name
                                          :op1 "Queen")
                                    :mod (c / country
                                          :name (n3 / name
                                                :op1 "Britain")))
                              :ARG0-of (l / lead-02))
                        :ARG1-of (ii2 / include-91
                              :ARG2 (v / vocalist
                                    :ARG1-of (h / have-degree-91
                                          :ARG2 (g2 / great)
                                          :ARG3 (m2 / most)
                                          :ARG5 (v2 / vocalist
                                                :time (t / time
                                                      :mod (a / all)))))))
                  :ARG1-of (c2 / cause-01
                        :ARG0 (m3 / movie
                              :name (n4 / name
                                    :op1 "Bohemian"
                                    :op2 "Rhapsody")
                              :ARG1-of (n5 / new-01)))))
      :snt2 (s2 / show-01
            :ARG0 (a2 / and
                  :op1 (a3 / admire-01
                        :ARG0 (p2 / person
                              :quant (m4 / multiple
                                    :op1 1000000)
                              :location (a4 / all-over
                                    :op1 (w / world)))
                        :ARG1 (h2 / he))
                  :op2 (c3 / continue-01
                        :ARG1 a3)
                  :concession (o / or
                        :op1 (w2 / white-02
                              :polarity -
                              :ARG1 h2)
                        :op2 (s3 / straight-05
                              :polarity -
                              :ARG1 h2)))
            :ARG1 (t2 / thing
                  :manner-of (m5 / matter-01
                        :polarity -
                        :ARG1 (d / differ-02
                              :mod (s4 / such))
                        :ARG1-of (r / real-04)
                        :mod (u / ultimate)))))

comment: Just because someone likes the same sex doesn't mean they are less than you.
amr:

            :ARG1 (s2 / same-sex))
      :ARG2 (l2 / less-than
            :op1 (y / you)
            :domain s)
      :mod (j / just))
